climbs.name: Y Crack
climbs.fa: Pete Noebels, Dennis Abbink, Larry Treiber

content.protection: Big gear if youre going to try and lead it... best to climb Turtles Piss on the backside and top-rope Y crack

content.description: This climb was thin but good practice for beginners
content.location: Other side of the Y Crack route; Used this route to set up top rope for Y crack...Use obvious cracks in the top for placement of gear as backup

content.description: Climb thin crack system just right of wide crack to gain left leaning hand crack. Climb crack to top of tower.
content.location: North face of boulder behind Y Crack boulder. Route is to the right of Chockstones on my Mind.

content.description: Short Chimney to hand crack to face that leads to top of ledge on the South side of the Y-Crack Boulder.
Fingertip crack leads to an Alcove on the East side of the smaller boulder in the Y-Crack Boulder area.
content.protection: Small to medium stoppers and Cams.
content.location: Furthest southeast corner on Boulder. Scramble descent.

content.description: The route starts with a lieback, then move to a finger crack about 12 feet off of the deck.  This is really your first option to place pro unless you bring micronuts, and getting up to crack is the crux of the climb (I fell twice on a #4 BD micronut).  After you get established in the crack it gets a little thin, but there's good stances all the way up.  Back boulder is off (if you can even reach it).  Shares anchors with Turtle Piss off to the left.  TR works fine with this one, but a directional piece is a must if you are going to do this.  Send it!
content.location: Northeast side of the Y-Crack boulder.  It is the thin right leaning crack just to the right of Jam on Jam.

content.description: A good climb for beginning crack climbers because the crack is pretty smooth on the inside and is easy on the hands.
content.protection: medium cams, neighborhood of .75 C4 I think.  Two rap anchors, two hangers on top of boulder so you can set a top rope if you lead one of the other climbs on the boulder.
content.location: On opposite side of boulder from the Y crack, big crack running up right hand side to the right of two bolt Corona Club climb.  North side of boulder.

content.description:
Difficult from the start and consistently requires that the climber use subtle layback and crabbing to make the thin holds work.  If only it were a little longer!   

  Follow the thin seam up a vertical face.
content.location: a few feet right of Turtle Piss on the North side of the Y-Crack Boulder.

content.description: Start under large chockstone. Short climb to chockstone and then clear chockstone.
content.location: Behind Y Crack boulder to northeast. From Turtles Piss walk Northeast behind Boulder. Route ends on top of Tashas Tower.

content.description: Y-Crack Boulder, named for the prominent Y-shaped cleft on it's southern side, is located northeast of Pinnacle Peak proper and accessed from the main hiker trail via a spur climber's trail that takes you to the base of the formation. The impressive Y-Crack route, rated 5.9, is a memorable old school introduction to wide crack climbing. There are also some moderate face routes on the back (north) side of the formation and rappel bolts on the summit.
